body.p: The comes bundled in the Oxygen XML Editor/Author distributions. The plugin id is: com.oxygenxml.pdf.css. It is installed in the [OXYGEN-INSTALL-DIR]frameworks/dita/DITA-OT2.x/plugins/com.oxygenxml.pdf.css folder.

This is how it works:
It expands all the topic references into a temporary clone of the map, resolving keys and reused content. This is the standard DITA-OT pre-processing procedure.
It generates a structure for the table of contents and index. The result is a merged map with all the references resolved. This is a standard DITA-OT processing procedure, based on the PDF2 plugin.
Then it post-processes the merged map. It fixes some of the structure in the TOC and index, moves the frontmatter and backmatter to the correct places, transforms any change tracking and review processing instructions to elements that can be styled later, etc. The result is another merged map.
In the last phase, it uses a collection of CSS files to style the merged map with the help of the CSS processor. Some of the CSS files are those selected in the Styles drop-down menu from the toolbar in Oxygen XML Editor/Author, and they are processed along with the CSS files specified with the args.css parameter set in the transformation scenario.
Ultimately, the process uses a series of stylesheets to tweak the merged map to a form that can be easily styled using CSS.
